comment: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, part one. The function formed by varying the right endpoint of an integral is differentiable at ` C ` with derivative ` F ( C ) ` if the original function is continuous at ` C ` . This is part of Metamath 100 proof #15. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Sep-2014.)
